lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/misaki.Misaki.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run misaki.Misaki.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
This repo contains the code for the Misaki chatbot as part of CS2103T: Software Engineering.
üå∏ Misaki üå∏ is a desktop chatbot for managing and storing tasks. Start chatting with this adorable Japanese bot to manage your tasks effectively! (‚Äû‚Ä¢ ‚ó° ‚Ä¢‚Äû) ‚ô°
1. Ensure you have Java `11` or above installed.
3. Move the file to the desired path as the home folder for your Misaki.
4. Right-click the file and open the app.
5. Try entering help and other commands. You should see a similar GUI as below. üå∑
5. Type the command in the command box and press `Enter` to execute it.
Some example commands you can try:
‚òòÔ∏è `todo` `complete assignment`: Adds a todo task `complete assignment` to the list.
üåº `deadline` `submit iP /by 2021-09-17 23:59`: Adds a deadline task `submit iP (by: 17 Sep 2020 23:59pm)` to the list.
‚òòÔ∏è `event` `birthday party /at 2021-09-19 18:00`: Adds an event task `birthday party (at: 19 Sep 2021 18:00pm)` to the list.
üåº `list`: Lists all the tasks in the list.
‚òòÔ∏è `done` `2`: Marks the task at the `2` index in the list as done.
üåº `delete` `2`: Deletes a task at the `2` index from the list.
‚òòÔ∏è `find` `assignment`: Finds all tasks with matching keyword `assignment`.
* Words in `UPPER_CASE` are the parameters to be supplied by the user. e.g. `todo DESCRIPTION`, `DESCRIPTION` is a parameter which can be used as `todo submit assignment`.
Adds a todo task to the list.
Adds a deadline task to the list.
Adds an event task to the list.
Lists all the tasks in the list.
Marks a task in the list as done.
* Marks the task at the specified index as done.
* The index refers to the index number of task in the list.
* The index must be a positive integer 1, 2, 3, ...
Deletes a task from the list.
* Deletes the task at the specified index from the list.
* The index refers to the index number of task in the list.
* The index must be a positive integer 1, 2, 3, ...
Finds all tasks with matching keyword.
* Finds all tasks containing the keyword.
Shows all available commands that the Masaki bot understands.
Misaki saves data automatically in the local storage after every valid user input.

**Deadline** | `deadline DESCRIPTION /by yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm`
e.g., `deadline submit iP /by 2021-09-17 23:59`
